title: Order of the Lotus Irelia
body:
Please give her shoes or sandals, it looks very weird especially cause she lifts her leg while using her q and in other animations. Also this skin feels sooo "2012" like I'm really disappointed with it but the least you can do is at least give her shoes.

Also disappointed since Irelia has no skin with real particles and you missed such an opportunity also please don't say variety or cheaper skins because all except FrostBlade are cheap including her legacy skin which when comes out of the vault will have a 50% off day like all other legacy skins.

You say you want to do justice for champions with no skins for a while but this is just a slap in the face.

replies.body: or instead of complaining you could just you know not buy it
I'm giving feedback and an opinion on a skin. I'm pretty sure Riot encourages this even if my opinion is not common.

Absolutely! 

Feedback from both sides is always encouraged, and helps with discussion on our end when it comes to potential changes to a skin in development. ^-^
I was hoping for a 1350 RP skin for her. :(

When we think about skins, we consider them in terms of scope, not price. 

So, for example, when we come up with a thematic - let's use Forsaken Jayce - rather than saying "what price point do we want for this?" we say, "What does this skin really need to fulfill this thematic/fantasty?" 

In Forsaken Jayce's case, we felt that new, dark particles and sounds really fit the thematic. Since his VO is usually more light-hearted, we felt giving his VO processing to sound more sinister really rounded out the thematic.

Unlike Order of the Lotus Karma (or Karma in general), Irelia is way less particle heavy, which is why we felt a model and texture change would fulfill this thematic. We did change her (R) particles to match the weapon, which are similar to the quality of life particles we gave to Warden Sivir. 

As you've seen in other skin lines - Debonair, Eternum or Arcade (which includes Final Boss), not every skin in the line has to be in the same price tier - it's more about what each champion needs individually, versus what the first skin in the line had.

You told us before. ^^ I was just hoping for a completely different feel for her, which is what a 1350 (or higher tier) skin would give. Despite her being particle light, y'all are capable of making a skin tier of 1350+ for her.

Not saying this skin isn't cool, it is, was just hoping for something bigger and better.

The downside to this is though, Irelia won't receive a new skin for at least another year (unless y'all make skins for champs more often (correct me if I'm wrong)), so it'll be a while before we can experience that amazing feel of a 1350 RP+ skin.

Totally understandable, and I appreciate your feedback. :] 

We've been making more skins than ever, so it's possible to see more skins for your favorite champions in the future. Not to mention, if we find her fitting into a holiday skin set, you might see something sooner rather than later, too! :]

We already have Frostbutt, so a Snowdown skin isn't likely, Pool Party Irelia confirmed?

* Water based particles and water based blades. 
* She splashes water every time she aa's something. 
* Her Q's animation would be like that of a water bullet or wave
* Her E brings down the waterfall on you and 
* Her R would be like shooting water blades.

I CAN SEE IT NOW!!
I can't read dammit.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=vh3yVEEQ,comment-id=00010000000100000000,timestamp=2015-05-14T16:48:58.990+0000)
>
> When we think about skins, we consider them in terms of scope, not price. 
> 
> So, for example, when we come up with a thematic - let's use Forsaken Jayce - rather than saying "what price point do we want for this?" we say, "What does this skin really need to fulfill this thematic/fantasty?"...

And again, you guys are handling this poorly. You should reverse this & make it price first, especially since your player-base seems to care much more about skin-tier.

I understand their point though, I mean, they could set out to create a 1350 RP skin, but then realize that some new VO's would perfect the skin which would make it a Legendary tier (1820 RP).

So it's best to stick to "Let's get a concept and build on it." Stop where appropriate for that skin, Ultimate Tier's the limit.

> [{quoted}](name=rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=vh3yVEEQ,comment-id=0001000000010000000000010000,timestamp=2015-05-14T17:37:37.330+0000)
>
> I understand their point though, I mean, they could set out to create a 1350 RP skin, but then realize that some new VO's would perfect the skin which would make it a Legendary tier (1820 RP).
> 
> So it's best to stick to "Let's get a concept and build on it." Stop where appropriate for that skin, Ultimate Tier's the limit.

It's fine if it changes in production.

The issue is all these skins getting undersold b/c they set the bar too low too frequently (e.g. Diamond Syndra... with orbs. Or Ezreal having a plethora of skins... only 1 having updated particles).

They need a cleaner spread & more of a big-picture attitude when it comes to scoping out a skin. Prioritizing price-tier will improve that are greatly.

Whoever thought Ezreal should get another 750 skin is bonkers.

Someone should've drafted the idea, "hey guys, Ezreal needs a skin somewhere between 975 & 1350 bracket."

Don't even get me started on who's bright idea it was to give him yet another skin right now too... that's another issue with how they scope out skin-lines for another topic.

Another fine example of scope before price... Marauder Ashe with base particles... completely ruins the skin. Somebody should've had the foresight to consider that skin needed particle recolor which would merit a tier-increase. Another case where pricing should've come first (or equally weighted, at least).

Good point. I agree they could have made some skins a higher quality, which would increase the price but in the end would probably be worth it, which I wouldn't mind. I'd actually want a better quality skin, even if it means paying more.
Didn't you say that 750 skins were an exception? That you decide on its price and what can go into it?

I don't believe I said it was an exception for 750 RP skins as a whole.  There are instances where we want to create a 750 RP set of skins, but that's different then when we're just creating a single skin. 

Again, we don't say 'we want 750 RP skins', we say, 'we want to create a lower-scope skin set that wouldn't require particles changes, unless they're quality of life changes.'

The point I'm trying to make here is that the development process focuses on scope, and the price is determined when the final product is complete.

That still feels like you're limiting yourself rather than trying to fulfill a fantasy. I think that's my concern regarding Queen Syndra as an example. That didn't seem like a good fit for a lower-scope skin without particle changes. I think that's something you should consider moving forward with particle heavy champions and 750 skins.
ok then instead of asking for changes just say you dont like it and be done with it because me and im pretty sure others think the skin is fine how it is

I agree. I'd like to see some sandals or something on her. Don't let the poor champ run around barefoot on the rift!  As far as particles, I'd love to see an update but as we saw with the new syndra skin...riot refuses to make changes to Particles on 750 skins :/.  I also posted my own comment that the coloring is kind of dark on this skin in general. I'd like to see lighter or softer colors to make it more unison to karmas skin.

Why does it feel "2012"? The other Order of the Lotus (Karma) is relatively new, being from 2014. I don't see any legacy themes like it, or at least I don't perceive them that way.

Anyway, what's wrong with no shoes, do bare feet disturb you? It looks fine to me. They budget a certain amount of resources towards each [skin tier](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3328361), making plans for about;

* 10-20% 750
* 50-75% 975
* 7-15% 1350
* 6-10% 1820
* and 2-4% 3250 RP skins a year 
(based on 2013 standardization)

Simply put, they can only do so many skins and they can't all be high tier. If they bumped it up, it would get moved to next year or something else would. There is no win-win situation, so you have to be content with the content. Also, think about all the poor, starving college students who skip 40 meals of ramen to purchase a skin; they deserve to get skins for their low budget for their champions too!

Okay but at the same time you are making more 750 skins which can be okay for non particle heavy champs like melee carries, but you are missing complete opportunities with some of the skins and new particles. Like ez for the weird alice in wonderland thing, complete miss on another ez skin with not particles. It sounds like yall are tired of particles. I'd rather see more 1350 skins and 950 skins like last year that include particles, we have totally had our fill on 750 skins because more was released recently then like ever before. We need skins now with particles not more new models.
